I am applying because I am involved with preparing new upstream kernels for Ubuntu. This work includes compatibility updates for the various DKMS modules in Ubuntu, mostly in LTS releases. I would like to be able to sponsor these uploads in order to reduce delays in getting DKMS fixes / updates and to reduce the burden on other sponsors.

== Who I am ==
I am currently working as a Kernel Engineer in the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/KernelTeam|Ubuntu Kernel Team]]</nowiki> at Canonical. I am specialized in operating systems, embedded systems and cybersecurity. I have a master's degree in Computer Science and Engineering from Politecnico of Milan. 

== My Ubuntu story ==
Ubuntu user since Ubuntu 7.04 "Feisty Fawn". Back then I bought the book "Hacking: The art of exploitation" and it was bundled with an Ubuntu 7.04 LiveCD. Since then Ubuntu has been my distro of choice.

=== Areas of work ===
My primary focus has been hardware enablement, backporting CVE fixes to LTS kernels, and fixing up packages impacted by kernel updates.

=== Things I could do better ===
My overall packaging experience is almost entirely with kernel (or kernel-adjacent) packages. I would like to extend my knowledge to a more diverse types of packages, for example user-space packages.

== Comments ==
''If you'd like to comment, but are not the applicant or a sponsor, do it here. Don't forget to sign with `@``SIG``@`.''

=== Mate Kukri (mkukri) ===

I have sponsored iptables-netflow 2.6-7.1ubuntu1 for Massimiliano, which addressed LP: #2116328.
The bug report and accompanying delta he provided were well-prepared and reasonable, and after a quick review I was happy to upload the package.

While I am confident that he has the necessary skills to be successful with this DKMS PPU application, I would defer to others with more experience sponsoring his uploads for a full endorsement.

=== Nick Rosbrook (enr0n) ===

I have sponsored one package, sysdig, for Massimiliano. It was for LP: #2114822, an SRU for Jammy. The debdiff was well-prepared. The only feedback I had was to suggest using the Bug-Ubuntu DEP3 field in the future.

-- <nowiki>[[LaunchpadHome:enr0n]]</nowiki>

== Endorsements ==
''As a sponsor, just copy the template below, fill it out and add it to this section.''

=== Paolo Pisati (ppisati) ===

==== General feedback ====

I have uploaded multiple dkms fix-ups from Massimiliano. There have been some small changes & reupload, but nothing groundbreaking.

==== Specific Experiences of working together ====
Many. He was a huge help with the point release, and a pleasure to work with.

==== Areas of Improvement ====
Can't think of anything.

=== Timo Aaltonen (tjaalton) ===
==== General feedback ====
I've been working with Massimiliano for roughly two years now, and he's always keen on finding the correct way to fix packages and knows how to ask for guidance. Due to me being on the SRU team, it has been more useful for other uploaders to sponsor so that I have been able to review from the SRU queue. This is why I haven't sponsored that many uploads so far. But the SRU uploads have all been good.

==== Specific Experiences of working together ====
I sponsored a merge of bbswitch and an update to lttng-modules, both to questing. I didn't find anything to complain about these packages.

==== Areas of Improvement ====
Continue with learning how the community processes function, and work towards motu/core-dev.
